ExperienceData.ShortDescription:
• The primary responsibility is to maintain server cluster of heavy computational requirements, monitoring grids and IT Infrastructure management
  • Managing Network, Linux desktops of various distributions and failsafe, backup and recovery
ExperienceData.Description:
The Institute of Bioinformatics is a non-profit organization engaged in Computational biology, Databases, Genomics and Proteomics research.

The primary responsibility is to maintain server cluster of heavy computational requirements, monitoring grids and IT Infrastructure management.

  • Configured Named Service for various domains of ibioinformatics using bind
  • Implemented Central Authentication System using OpenLDAP for mail, samba, egroupware, messaging sytem, Internal website and ftp.
  • Migrated Oracle data to mysql for the database Human Protein Reference Database (HPRD)
  • Implemented OpenVZ virtualization in production, staging and development environments.
  • Worked extensively on zope, plone and bioinformatics databases.
  • Designed and implemented 10TB NAS solution.
  • Worked on BOINC grid technology

Projects.Title: Implementation of Collaboration Platform
Projects.ShortDescription: A common platform for all the common needs of Email, Calendaring and Enterprise Applications for the internal use.
Projects.Tools: Apache, PHP, MYSQL, HTML, JQuery, Zimbra Collaboration Platform
Projects.Description:
• Researching, testing and finalizing the right Open Source Platform.
  • Installation and Configuration on Linux Server
  • Maintenance of the Zimbra and monitoring
  • Provide credentials to users and train them to use it.

ExperienceData.ShortDescription:
• Internal and external infrastructure management, It resource management and strategy planning
  • Supporting both teams of Developers and Technical Recruiters
ExperienceData.Description:
Stivant is a One-Stop Enterprise Solutions Provider. From design and development to implementation and support can be provided for any business needs. It provides services like Application Development, Project Outsourcing and Staff Augmentation, Help Desk Support, e-Business Solutions etc.,

Internal and external infrastructure management, Support to developers and clients. IT resource management and strategy planning.

  • Migrated existing linux servers to Linux based virtualization with OpenVZ
  • Worked on OpenVZ extensively in cloning existing production servers for staging
  • Provided technical support to internal and external users of stivant through chat, mail and voice.
  • Initiated a project management tool (gforge) which deals with Development Environment as well as Project management.
  • Provided support in the areas of central authentication system, webcal, timesheets, Cerberus.
  • Developed a perl based dynamic web page to manage internal user’s mail settings and procmail rules.
  • Developed a php based dynamic web page to read and display LDAP directory information.

Projects.Title: Server Migration to Virtualization
Projects.ShortDescription: Migration of various flavored unix and linux physical servers to OpenVZ containers which include centos, ubuntu and  debian
Projects.LineOfBusiness: Managed Offshore Development, Outsourced Support Services and Web Content Management and Publishing
Projects.Tools: CentOS Linux 5.5, Ubuntu,  OpenVZ, OpenLDAP, Samba, Apache, MySQL, CerberusWeb, SugarCRM
Projects.Description:
• Preparation of Implementation plan and personal task distribution
  • Server Backup
  • Data transfer from legacy servers to Virtual Private Servers
  • Setting up staging environment for testing
  • Making sure there not much downtime than planned duration
  • Coordinating with the users and clients regarding migration and possible errors.
  • Managing Live Backup on Virtual Servers

ExperienceData.ShortDescription:
• Maintainance of both local and co-location servers
  • Implementation and maintenance of IT infrastructure, OS up-gradation, Inventory management, allotment and monitoring
ExperienceData.Description:
Indiainfo.com Ltd., an integrated Internet company, delivers content, community and commerce to Indian consumers and businesses

Primary responsibility is to maintain servers (local / remote) with 0% downtime, further responsibilities includes implementation and maintenance IT infrastructure, OS up-gradation, Inventory management, allotment and monitoring.

Tasks Handled:

  • Updated and synchronized 12 production linux servers with local servers at 0% downtime.
  • Successfully installed and managed Web Hosting servers with ISPConfig.
  • Migrated windows based MDaemon mail server to linux based qmail
  • Implemented central authentication system with NIS for local infrastructure access
  • Installed and monitored linux based proxy server (IPCop) for internet sharing.
  • Designed, implemented and automated log rotate system using shell script.
  • Implemented Log analysis for the visits of indiainfo.com site using webtrendz

Projects.Title: Server Management
Projects.ShortDescription: Distribution and separation of hardware and servers between two companies
Projects.Tools: Redhat Linux 9, CentOS, Ubuntu, Samba, Apache, MySQL, Windows 2000 Servers
Projects.Description:
• Preparation of Hardware, Software and License listing
  • Distributing both onsite and co-location servers
  • Managing the public servers to make sure 99% uptime
  • Re-installation and configuration of both in-house and co-location servers when required.
  • Updating, patching and maintaining both Servers and in-house computers
  • Managing Network, Routers and Windows work stations

ExperienceData.ShortDescription:
• Responsible for Linux server management OS installation, troubleshooting, diagnostics and upgrades
  • The position also involves 24/7 point of contact for Data Services
ExperienceData.Description:
VIS uses state-of-the-art technology, digital dictation systems, well-qualified and experienced technical staff, and high-end web based technology platform offering total solutions for US healthcare documentation requirements. Its online workflow application manages the full life cycle of electronic documents including dictation, transcription, and quality assurance document delivery.

Responsible for Linux server management, including hardware maintenance, OS installation, troubleshooting, diagnostics and upgrades. Further responsibilities include media distribution, network implementation, training, coding and documentation.

The position also involves 24/7 point of contact for Data Services, operating in 12-hour shifts. Also addressed general system administration queries as third line support, assisted company clients with technical issues, and was always on call for emergencies.

DETAILS OF SKILLS USED: Linux and Windows Server Installation, Configuration and Support. Coding in VB, ASP, php, Shell scripting and MySQL.

Projects.Title: Automation of Dictation Files Flow
Projects.ShortDescription: Automation for the flow of in-bound dictation files to out-bound transcription files
Projects.Tools: Redhat Linux 9, Samba, MySQL, PHP, Visual Basic, MS Word Macros, Schell and Batch scripts
Projects.Description:
Client calls the Dictation Server and provides dictation which will be recorded on the server and needs to be translated and sent back the client within the agreed duration. The flow of files must be automated in order to fulfill accuracy and on time delivery of transcribed documents.

  • Installation and maintenance of Dictation Servers
  • Preparation / monitoring scripts windows task scheduler, batch scripts to sync files to local server
  • Manage auto syncing with the mysql database based on the file name
  • Assigning file/task to transcriptionists using PHP web environment
  • Monitoring completed transcription files on samba server and sending them to client based on their output criteria

ProjectsData.Title: Step-by-Step Developing Web Apps using Go
ProjectsData.ShortDescription: This video tutorial will help to write Go Lang Starters to create a Basic Web Server which serves a couple of test pages.
ProjectsData.Description:
This video series illustrates how to create a basic Web Application using GoLanguage.
This series has been divided into 4 parts

  1. Basic Server : Creates a Basic Web Server which serves a test page
  2. Routing : Handling dynamic URL
  3. Static Pages : Preparing and Serving Static HTML pages
  4. Templates : Using GoLang template package

Further works include Installation and Creating a Hello World! Program

  • Step-by-Step Go installation on Windows
  • Step-by-Step Hello World! in Golang

ProjectsData.Title: RESTful web services platform using Joomla! Framework
ProjectsData.ShortDescription: This video series explains about Building a RESTful web services platform using Joomla! Framework
ProjectsData.Description:
The Joomla! Framework is a new PHP framework (a collection of software libraries/packages) for writing web and command line applications in PHP. It does not comes with all the bells and whistles, so useful for php applications which use minimal packages like REST.
This series has been divided into 6 parts

  1. Setting up the structure
  2. Routing
  3. Configuration File
  4. Log File
  5. Accessing Database
  6. Code Cleanup

Please check the other videos related to PHP and Joomla Framework

  • XAMPP Installation on Windows 8
  • Git Client installation on Windows 8
  • Composer installation on Windows 8
  • Step by Step: Joomla Framework Sample App Installation

ProjectsData.Title: Joomla 3.0 for Developers: Module Development
ProjectsData.ShortDescription: A developer's guide to Module Development using Joomla 3.0
ProjectsData.Description:
In this video tutorial we create a simple Quick Contact module for joomla 3.0

This video has been divided in to 4 segments

  1. Creating a Basic Module
  2. Creating and using Module Configuration Fields
  3. Using Helper classes and forms
  4. Sending mail from the Module

ProjectsData.Title: Joomla 3.0 Administration for Beginners
ProjectsData.ShortDescription: A video series on Joomla 3.0 Administration
ProjectsData.Description:
Joomla is not only user/developer friendly CMS, but also mobile friendly from version 3.0 onwards. In this video series we will discuss about handling Joomla Administrator panel
This series has been divided into 5 parts

  1. Installation
  2. Managing Categories
  3. Creating Articles
  4. Menus and Menu Items
  5. Backup and Restore using Akeeba Backup Core

ProjectsData.Title: The Perfect Setup - OpenVZ with CentOS 4.4
ProjectsData.ShortDescription: A Step by Step tutorial on Setting up OpenVZ
ProjectsData.Description: In this HowTo I have described how to prepare a CentOS 4.4 server for OpenVZ virtual machines. With OpenVZ you can create multiple Virtual Private Servers (VPS) on the same hardware, similar to Xen and the Linux Vserver project. OpenVZ is the open-source branch of Virtuozzo, a commercial virtualization solution used by many providers that offer virtual servers.

ProjectsData.Title: OpenLDAP Server in a container
ProjectsData.ShortDescription: A Step by Step tutorial on Setting up OpenLDAP
ProjectsData.Description: This tutorial describes how to install and configure an OpenLDAP server and also an OpenLDAP client.

ProjectsData.Title: Learning C/C++ Step-By-Step
ProjectsData.ShortDescription: Learners guide to C and C++
ProjectsData.Description: This tutorial starts with C language and leads to C++ by including comparision and explaination

ProjectsData.Title: Step-by-Step IPP based Print Server using CUPS
ProjectsData.ShortDescription: A Step by Step guide on IPP based Print Server
ProjectsData.Tools: Linux, Redhat, IPP Print Server, CUPS
ProjectsData.Description: This tutorial describes how to install a Linux print server with CUPS. It also covers the installation and configuration of printer drivers on the print server as well as the printer setup on a Windows 2000 client.

ProjectsData.Title: Step-By-Step Configuration of NAT with iptables
ProjectsData.ShortDescription: A Step by Step guide on configuring NAT with iptables
ProjectsData.Description: This tutorial shows how to set up network-address-translation (NAT) on a Linux system with iptables rules so that the system can act as a gateway and provide internet access to multiple hosts on a local network using a single public IP address. This is achieved by rewriting the source and/or destination addresses of IP packets as they pass through the NAT system.
